result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Edward J. Deyo was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross. Bond on files applied.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Provide a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Huber for alcohol or drug abuse treatment purposes, including AA meetings, and for child care purposes to a maximum of 5 hrs per week.

Defendant Edward J Deyo in court with attorney Dennis Michael Melowski. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CT112, 16CF92, 15CF315, and 16TR378.      Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT112 Ct 1: OWI 3rd: No Contest
15CF315 Ct 1: OWI 4th: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CT112 Ct 2 and 15CF315 Ct 2 are dismissed. 15CF315 Ct 3, 16CF92 are DRI. 16TR378 is dismissed.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing recommendation.
Atty Melowski concurs with joint agreement and request huber for AAA meetings or any other treatment sessions and child care. 

BY THE COURT:****

15CT112 Ct 1: OWI 3rd:
50 days jail w/huber for alcohol or drug abuse treatment purposes, meetings, sessions and eligible for child care purposes up to 5 hrs per week.
$1,757.00 fine/costs/surcharges, 60 days to pay or set up payment plan
$26.45 Blood draw
27 months Revocation of DL
27 months IID
DOT/Safety plan

15CF315 Ct 1: OWI 4th: 
W/H Sentence: 24 months PROBATION
210 days jail, concurrent with 15CT112 w/huber for alcohol or drug abuse treatment purposes, meetings, sessions and eligible for child care purposes up to 5 hrs per week.
$2,198.00 fine/costs/surcharges
31 months Revocation of DL, concurrent with 15CT112
31 months IID, concurrent with 15CT112
DOT/Safety plan
